1067851.name: CVE-2023-0361 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
1067851.description: A timing side-channel in the handling of RSA ClientKeyExchange messages was discovered in GnuTLS. This side-channel can be sufficient to recover the key encrypted in the RSA ciphertext across a network in a Bleichenbacher style attack. To achieve a successful decryption the attacker would need to send a large amount of specially crafted messages to the vulnerable server. By recovering the secret from the ClientKeyExchange message, the attacker would be able to decrypt the application data exchanged over that connection.

1093621.name: CVE-2023-26604 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1093621.description: systemd before 247 does not adequately block local privilege escalation for some Sudo configurations, e.g., plausible sudoers files in which the "systemctl status" command may be executed. Specifically, systemd does not set LESSSECURE to 1, and thus other programs may be launched from the less program. This presents a substantial security risk when running systemctl from Sudo, because less executes as root when the terminal size is too small to show the complete systemctl output.

1093625.name: CVE-2023-26604 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1093625.description: systemd before 247 does not adequately block local privilege escalation for some Sudo configurations, e.g., plausible sudoers files in which the "systemctl status" command may be executed. Specifically, systemd does not set LESSSECURE to 1, and thus other programs may be launched from the less program. This presents a substantial security risk when running systemctl from Sudo, because less executes as root when the terminal size is too small to show the complete systemctl output.

1098326.name: CVE-2023-29383 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1098326.description: In Shadow 4.13, it is possible to inject control characters into fields provided to the SUID program chfn (change finger). Although it is not possible to exploit this directly (e.g., adding a new user fails because \n is in the block list), it is possible to misrepresent the /etc/passwd file when viewed. Use of \r manipulations and Unicode characters to work around blocking of the : character make it possible to give the impression that a new user has been added. In other words, an adversary may be able to convince a system administrator to take the system offline (an indirect, social-engineered denial of service) by demonstrating that "cat /etc/passwd" shows a rogue user account.

1098329.name: CVE-2023-29383 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1098329.description: In Shadow 4.13, it is possible to inject control characters into fields provided to the SUID program chfn (change finger). Although it is not possible to exploit this directly (e.g., adding a new user fails because \n is in the block list), it is possible to misrepresent the /etc/passwd file when viewed. Use of \r manipulations and Unicode characters to work around blocking of the : character make it possible to give the impression that a new user has been added. In other words, an adversary may be able to convince a system administrator to take the system offline (an indirect, social-engineered denial of service) by demonstrating that "cat /etc/passwd" shows a rogue user account.

1098386.name: CVE-2023-29491 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
1098386.description: ncurses before 6.4 20230408, when used by a setuid application, allows local users to trigger security-relevant memory corruption via malformed data in a terminfo database file that is found in $HOME/.terminfo or reached via the TERMINFO or TERM environment variable.

1098390.name: CVE-2023-29491 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
1098390.description: ncurses before 6.4 20230408, when used by a setuid application, allows local users to trigger security-relevant memory corruption via malformed data in a terminfo database file that is found in $HOME/.terminfo or reached via the TERMINFO or TERM environment variable.

1098411.name: CVE-2023-29491 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.

1188920.name: CVE-2017-18018 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1188920.description: In GNU Coreutils through 8.29, chown-core.c in chown and chgrp does not prevent replacement of a plain file with a symlink during use of the POSIX "-R -L" options, which allows local users to modify the ownership of arbitrary files by leveraging a race condition.

1247444.name: CVE-2018-20796 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
1247444.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(\227|)(\\1\\1|t1|\\\2537)+' in grep.

1247451.name: CVE-2018-20796 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
1247451.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(\227|)(\\1\\1|t1|\\\2537)+' in grep.

1280138.name: CVE-2019-1010022 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1280138.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass stack guard protection. The component is: nptl. The attack vector is: Exploit stack buffer overflow vulnerability and use this bypass vulnerability to bypass stack guard. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat."

1280144.name: CVE-2019-1010022 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1280144.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass stack guard protection. The component is: nptl. The attack vector is: Exploit stack buffer overflow vulnerability and use this bypass vulnerability to bypass stack guard. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat."

1280228.name: CVE-2019-1010023 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1280228.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded library with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat."

1280234.name: CVE-2019-1010023 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1280234.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Re-mapping current loaded library with malicious ELF file. The impact is: In worst case attacker may evaluate privileges. The component is: libld. The attack vector is: Attacker sends 2 ELF files to victim and asks to run ldd on it. ldd execute code. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat."

1280302.name: CVE-2019-1010024 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1280302.description: ** DISPUTED ** GNU Libc current is affected by: Mitigation bypass. The impact is: Attacker may bypass ASLR using cache of thread stack and heap. The component is: glibc. NOTE: Upstream comments indicate "this is being treated as a non-security bug and no real threat."

1280308.name: CVE-2019-1010024 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.

1318854.name: CVE-2019-6488 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
1318854.description: The string component in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, when running on the x32 architecture, incorrectly attempts to use a 64-bit register for size_t in assembly codes, which can lead to a segmentation fault or possibly unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by a crash in __memmove_avx_unaligned_erms in sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S during a memcpy.

1318860.name: CVE-2019-6488 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
1318860.description: The string component in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, when running on the x32 architecture, incorrectly attempts to use a 64-bit register for size_t in assembly codes, which can lead to a segmentation fault or possibly unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by a crash in __memmove_avx_unaligned_erms in sysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S during a memcpy.

1319333.name: CVE-2019-7309 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
1319333.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, the memcmp function for the x32 architecture can incorrectly return zero (indicating that the inputs are equal) because the RDX most significant bit is mishandled.

1319339.name: CVE-2019-7309 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
1319339.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, the memcmp function for the x32 architecture can incorrectly return zero (indicating that the inputs are equal) because the RDX most significant bit is mishandled.

1323720.description: ** REJECT ** DO NOT USE THIS CANDIDATE NUMBER. ConsultIDs: none. Reason: This candidate was withdrawn by its CNA. Further investigation showed that it was not a security issue. Notes: none.

1349482.name: CVE-2020-13776 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1349482.description: systemd through v245 mishandles numerical usernames such as ones composed of decimal digits or 0x followed by hex digits, as demonstrated by use of root privileges when privileges of the 0x0 user account were intended. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082.

1349490.name: CVE-2020-13776 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.

1372926.name: CVE-2020-23026 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1372926.description: A NULL pointer dereference in the main() function dhry_1.c of dhrystone 2.1 causes a denial of service (DoS).

1373341.name: CVE-2020-23026 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.

1373553.name: CVE-2020-23026 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.

1444596.name: CVE-2021-33574 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
1444596.description: The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact.

1444601.name: CVE-2021-33574 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.

It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact.

1451461.name: CVE-2021-3997 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
1451461.description: A flaw was found in systemd. An uncontrolled recursion in systemd-tmpfiles may lead to a denial of service at boot time when too many nested directories are created in /tmp.

1451464.name: CVE-2021-3997 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
1451464.description: A flaw was found in systemd. An uncontrolled recursion in systemd-tmpfiles may lead to a denial of service at boot time when too many nested directories are created in /tmp.

1484533.name: CVE-2022-4415 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
1484533.description: A vulnerability was found in systemd. This security flaw can cause a local information leak due to systemd-coredump not respecting the fs.suid_dumpable kernel setting.

1484535.name: CVE-2022-4415 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
1484535.description: A vulnerability was found in systemd. This security flaw can cause a local information leak due to systemd-coredump not respecting the fs.suid_dumpable kernel setting.

318978.name: CVE-2009-5155 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
318978.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match.

320239.name: CVE-2013-4235 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
320239.description: shadow: TOCTOU (time-of-check time-of-use) race condition when copying and removing directory trees

320241.name: CVE-2013-4235 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
320241.description: shadow: TOCTOU (time-of-check time-of-use) race condition when copying and removing directory trees

322426.name: CVE-2015-8985 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
322426.description: The pop_fail_stack function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application crash) via vectors related to extended regular expression processing.

322428.name: CVE-2015-8985 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
322428.description: The pop_fail_stack function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application crash) via vectors related to extended regular expression processing.

323037.name: CVE-2016-10739 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
323037.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings.

323039.name: CVE-2016-10739 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
323039.description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings.

323292.name: CVE-2016-20013 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
323292.description: sha256crypt and sha512crypt through 0.6 allow attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) because the algorithm's runtime is proportional to the square of the length of the password.

323295.name: CVE-2016-20013 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
323295.description: sha256crypt and sha512crypt through 0.6 allow attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) because the algorithm's runtime is proportional to the square of the length of the password.

323650.name: CVE-2016-2781 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
323650.description: chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

327571.name: CVE-2017-11164 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
327571.description: In PCRE 8.41, the OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c allows stack exhaustion (uncontrolled recursion) when processing a crafted regular expression.

381008.name: CVE-2018-1000654 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
381008.description: GNU Libtasn1-4.13 libtasn1-4.13 version libtasn1-4.13, libtasn1-4.12 contains a DoS, specifically CPU usage will reach 100% when running asn1Paser against the POC due to an issue in _asn1_expand_object_id(p_tree), after a long time, the program will be killed. This attack appears to be exploitable via parsing a crafted file.

391352.name: CVE-2018-12886 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
391352.description: stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.

391532.name: CVE-2018-12886 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
391532.description: stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.

391644.name: CVE-2018-12886 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
391644.description: stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.

398440.name: CVE-2018-16868 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
398440.description: A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way gnutls handles verification of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this to extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

441591.name: CVE-2019-15847 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
441591.description: The POWER9 backend in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) before version 10 could optimize multiple calls of the __builtin_darn intrinsic into a single call, thus reducing the entropy of the random number generator. This occurred because a volatile operation was not specified. For example, within a single execution of a program, the output of every __builtin_darn() call may be the same.

756213.name: CVE-2022-27943 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
756213.description: libiberty/rust-demangle.c in GNU GCC 11.2 allows stack consumption in demangle_const, as demonstrated by nm-new.

756287.name: CVE-2022-27943 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
756287.description: libiberty/rust-demangle.c in GNU GCC 11.2 allows stack consumption in demangle_const, as demonstrated by nm-new.

788381.name: CVE-2022-29458 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
788381.description: ncurses 6.3 before patch 20220416 has an out-of-bounds read and segmentation violation in convert_strings in tinfo/read_entry.c in the terminfo library.

824474.name: CVE-2022-3219 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
824474.description: GnuPG can be made to spin on a relatively small input by (for example) crafting a public key with thousands of signatures attached, compressed down to just a few KB.
